column4: I'm sorry if someone replied to my first request for help with madwifi, as soon as my message as sent, I got stalled by my wireless card...
Can anyone help with installing madwifi?  Or another alternative to ndiswrapper?
me
you want the package module-assistant
you also want the headers for your kernel
Will the package module-assistant update drivers or softwar to improve my ability to keep a WLAN connection?
no. module-assistant will help you build kernel modules
you want to download the madwifi source and build a kernel module to run your card
you do have an atheros card, yes?
I am a newbie to Linux and Ubuntu, so source builds are a bit intimidating...
that's what module-assistant is for
there's no other way to use madwifi
Will the module assistant get the source like 'apt-get'?
no, but the source is really easy to google up
Will building madwifi automatically make it the default for my wireless card?
no, but that's one easy extra step
you want to go to http://www.marlow.dk/site.php/tech/madwifi
under the "Repository" heading you'll see two lines starting with "deb"
add those lines to /etc/apt/sources.list
then have synaptic do an update
after you've done that, you can use synaptic/aptitude/apt-get to get the madwifi source
the alternative if you don't want the most up-to-date version: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/MoreRecentMadwifiHowto?highlight=%28madwifi%29
did you already try what's shown in the wiki?
